title.value: Yair Orgler, Former Head of Tel Aviv Stock Exchange, Appointed Visiting Fellow at Milken Institute

value: Yair E. Orgler, who recently retired after 10 years as chairman of the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange (TASE), has been appointed a Visiting Fellow at the Milken Institute for the summer of 2006. Orgler will concentrate on Israeli capital-market reform projects that Institute researchers have been working on for many years, and will be based at the Institute′s offices in Santa Monica. Orgler stepped down as chairman of the board of TASE after his second term ended June 1. He has been credited with increasing the number of companies listed on the exchange, the securities available for trade and the volume of trade, as well as improving transparency and technology. Between 2001 and 2004 he was president of the International Options Markets Association. He previously served as founder and chairman of Maalot, Israel′s first securities rating company; chairman of the Wage Committee of the Association of University Heads in Israel; chairman of the Executive Council of the Academic College of Tel-Aviv Yaffo; and member of the board of the United States-Israel Educational Foundation. Orgler has served as vice rector of Tel-Aviv University and dean of the university′s Leon Recanati Graduate School of Business Administration. For more than 20 years, he was the incumbent of the Goldreich Chair in International Banking at Tel-Aviv University and served frequently as a visiting professor of finance at the Kellogg Graduate School of Management at Northwestern University. He has published 11 books and monographs on finance and banking, and more than 40 academic and professional articles.
